New Records: Tarik Skubal became the fourth Detroit Tigers left-hander with 200 strikeouts in a season, later achieving 201, a milestone not reached by Jack Morris
Key Match Events: The Tigers won the game 2-1 with key plays including Tyler O'Neill's first-inning homer and two runs in the second inning
Trey Sweeney hit a fly ball to left that drove in two runs
Spencer Torkelson hit a one-out single and Zach McKinstry extended his career-best 11-game hitting streak with a double
Kreidler made up for his mistake in the eighth, retiring Triston Casas with a jump throw from foul territory behind third
Pre-Game Insights: Manager A.J. Hinch emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance and noted the Tigers' aggressive strategy in the game
Alex Cora discussed the Red Sox's preparation and the decision to send McKinstry to the plate
Post-Match Reflections: Manager A.J. Hinch reflected on the game's significance and Skubal's performance
Alex Cora highlighted the importance of the series win for the Red Sox
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Tigers celebrated their 1984 World Series championship with a special night and crowd reactions
Rich Hill, the only player on either roster who was born when the Tigers last won the World Series, made a catch in the seventh inning
Others: The game was significant for the Tigers' playoff push and Skubal's potential Cy Young award consideration
